title: Bobby Prince's Doom IIV song
content:
Actually I basically posted here right after reading [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Robert_Prince]Wikipedia's article on BP[/url], so I haven't even listened to it myself, but BP composed a new song to download on [url=http://www.bpmusic.com/]his site[/url]. (Edit: I finally downloaded a BitTorrent client to try this out, only to find out I can't use it. It seems like nobody is sharing it, but maybe it's because of firewall issues, as I didn't set up this network, nor have I any idea what the client expects exactly. In other words, no idea what the song is like.)

Apparently he likes to hear our opinions about the song, so that's a very good excuse for e-mailing somebody who added a lot to Keen's personality.

I suppose it's a pretty decent way of asking him to try another Keenish song as well, which is my excuse for putting this in the "Other Keen Stuff" forum. :PRetodon8
Sheep happens! [url=http://keen.retodon8.net/][img]http://retodon8.net/Graphics/Keen_Yorp.gif[/img][/url]

title: Re: Bobby Prince's Doom IIV song
content:
Oh cool! I was kinda like "Awww!" when they didn't get BP to do the theme song for Doom three. I thought that would of been cool.

The song doesn't... seem to be starting for me either. No one has the file it seems. [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-sad.gif[/img]

Mr.Prince... could definitely use some help on his HTML skills though. [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-cheeky.gif[/img]

Edit: Ok I lied. It downloaded when I wasn't looking. If you can't download it like... IM me on MSN or something. I'll give it to you.
Oh and I will continue to seed it too.-----------------------
[url=http://Galaxie.Spatang.com][img]http://i34.photobucket.com/albums/d134/Galaxieretter/New-blegd-smeeg-banner-60.png[/img][/url]

title: Re: Bobby Prince's Doom IIV song
content:
Hey... this... err... cool!
It seems I forgot to close my Turrent (I just picked one from BP's site, it sounded familiar, I hope it's a decent/good one), and apparently it found you and/or some other feed(s), because when I just came down again, it was all there.
Thanks for the offer though, and probably the seed!

About the HTML...
I sort of already noticed that on his earlier incarnation of the site.
Now the split links alone made me realise it hadn't improved. [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-smile.gif[/img]

OK, the song is done now, and I definately recognise BP's work.
I was a little bit afraid if he'd make a new piece (from what I found out a while ago it seemed like he stopped composing) it'd sound somewhat alien, but it doesn't.
I suppose style runs deeper through people's veigns than I thought.
As for compatibility with Doom 3... no idea.
I bought the game a month ago or so for cheap, found the expansion for half that so picked it up as well, but I'm actually not even sure if my current computer will run it.Retodon8
Sheep happens! [url=http://keen.retodon8.net/][img]http://retodon8.net/Graphics/Keen_Yorp.gif[/img][/url]

title: This is DOOM!!
content:
Wow. That is awesome! It has DOOM written all over it, and does indeed have the oldschool Bobby Prince sound to it.

[hr]Bobby Prince Enjoy! If this works well, I will be releasing hundreds of songs in this manner.
[hr][img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-drool.gif[/img] I must email him some feedback.

content:
That's what I thought too.

It'd be III, because there are two I's in front of the V. Normally this wouldn't count, but yeah... [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-dead.gif[/img]

Does that mean this will be a Doom III remake or something?___________________
DaVince, Yet Another Amateur Game Creator! :P

title: Re: This is DOOM!!
content:
A remake?
I don't think I really understand the question, but I think [url=http://www.bpmusic.com/]Bobby Prince's site[/url] will tell you what you want to know:
[quote]Quote:[hr]Want to hear what I probably would have written for a theme to the latest DOOM?[hr][/quote]Retodon8

title: hum.
content:
I think it takes too long to get where it's going... it'd work fine as a tune on a level once the game has developed a bit, and we're already engaged by the art, level design, and pacing... but as an intro/first song, this doesn't leave me pumped to kill some Hellspawn. :-) E1M1 and the End Level tune are still best for that.

I do like the pizzicato and chimes halfway through, though--it's got that classic DooM feel.
